verses.verse: Hearken<WH8085> to me, ye that follow after<WH7291> righteousness<WH6664>, ye that seek<WH1245> the LORD<WH3068>: look<WH5027> unto the rock<WH6697> whence ye are hewn<WH2672>, and to the hole<WH4718> of the pit<WH953> whence ye are digged<WH5365>.
Look<WH5027> unto Abraham<WH85> your father<WH1>, and unto Sarah<WH8283> that bare<WH2342> you: for I called<WH7121> him alone<WH259>, and blessed<WH1288> him, and increased<WH7235> him.

For the LORD<WH3068> shall comfort<WH5162> Zion<WH6726>: he will comfort<WH5162> all her waste places<WH2723>; and he will make<WH7760> her wilderness<WH4057> like Eden<WH5731>, and her desert<WH6160> like the garden<WH1588> of the LORD<WH3068>; joy<WH8342> and gladness<WH8057> shall be found<WH4672> therein, thanksgiving<WH8426>, and the voice<WH6963> of melody<WH2172>.

¶ Hearken<WH7181> unto me, my people<WH5971>; and give ear<WH238> unto me, O my nation<WH3816>: for a law<WH8451> shall proceed<WH3318> from me, and I will make my judgment<WH4941> to rest<WH7280> for a light<WH216> of the people<WH5971>.

My righteousness<WH6664> is near<WH7138>; my salvation<WH3468> is gone forth<WH3318>, and mine arms<WH2220> shall judge<WH8199> the people<WH5971>; the isles<WH339> shall wait<WH6960> upon me, and on mine arm<WH2220> shall they trust<WH3176>.

Lift up<WH5375> your eyes<WH5869> to the heavens<WH8064>, and look<WH5027> upon the earth<WH776> beneath: for the heavens<WH8064> shall vanish away<WH4414> like smoke<WH6227>, and the earth<WH776> shall wax old<WH1086> like a garment<WH899>, and they that dwell<WH3427> therein shall die<WH4191> in like<WH3644> manner<WH3654>: but my salvation<WH3444> shall be for ever<WH5769>, and my righteousness<WH6666> shall not be abolished<WH2865>.

¶ Hearken<WH8085> unto me, ye that know<WH3045> righteousness<WH6664>, the people<WH5971> in whose heart<WH3820> is my law<WH8451>; fear<WH3372> ye not the reproach<WH2781> of men<WH582>, neither be ye afraid<WH2865> of their revilings<WH1421>.

For the moth<WH6211> shall eat them up<WH398> like a garment<WH899>, and the worm<WH5580> shall eat<WH398> them like wool<WH6785>: but my righteousness<WH6666> shall be for ever<WH5769>, and my salvation<WH3444> from generation<WH1755> to generation<WH1755>.

¶ Awake<WH5782>, awake<WH5782>, put on<WH3847> strength<WH5797>, O arm<WH2220> of the LORD<WH3068>; awake<WH5782>, as in the ancient<WH6924> days<WH3117>, in the generations<WH1755> of old<WH5769>. Art thou not it that hath cut<WH2672> Rahab<WH7294>, and wounded<WH2490> the dragon<WH8577>?

Art thou not it which hath dried<WH2717> the sea<WH3220>, the waters<WH4325> of the great<WH7227> deep<WH8415>; that hath made<WH7760> the depths<WH4615> of the sea<WH3220> a way<WH1870> for the ransomed<WH1350> to pass over<WH5674>?

Therefore the redeemed<WH6299> of the LORD<WH3068> shall return<WH7725>, and come<WH935> with singing<WH7440> unto Zion<WH6726>; and everlasting<WH5769> joy<WH8057> shall be upon their head<WH7218>: they shall obtain<WH5381> gladness<WH8342> and joy<WH8057>; and sorrow<WH3015> and mourning<WH585> shall flee away<WH5127>.

I, even I, am he that comforteth<WH5162> you: who art thou, that thou shouldest be afraid<WH3372> of a man<WH582> that shall die<WH4191>, and of the son<WH1121> of man<WH120> which shall be made<WH5414> as grass<WH2682>;

And forgettest<WH7911> the LORD<WH3068> thy maker<WH6213>, that hath stretched forth<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064>, and laid the foundations<WH3245> of the earth<WH776>; and hast feared<WH6342> continually<WH8548> every day<WH3117> because<WH6440> of the fury<WH2534> of the oppressor<WH6693>, as if<WH834> he were ready<WH3559> to destroy<WH7843>? and where is the fury<WH2534> of the oppressor<WH6693>?
The captive exile<WH6808> hasteneth<WH4116> that he may be loosed<WH6605>, and that he should not die<WH4191> in the pit<WH7845>, nor that his bread<WH3899> should fail<WH2637>.
But I am the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, that divided<WH7280> the sea<WH3220>, whose waves<WH1530> roared<WH1993>: The LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name<WH8034>.

And I have put<WH7760> my words<WH1697> in thy mouth<WH6310>, and I have covered<WH3680> thee in the shadow<WH6738> of mine hand<WH3027>, that I may plant<WH5193> the heavens<WH8064>, and lay the foundations<WH3245> of the earth<WH776>, and say<WH559> unto Zion<WH6726>, Thou art my people<WH5971>.

¶ Awake<WH5782>, awake<WH5782>, stand up<WH6965>, O Jerusalem<WH3389>, which hast drunk<WH8354> at the hand<WH3027> of the LORD<WH3068> the cup<WH3563> of his fury<WH2534>; thou hast drunken<WH8354> the dregs<WH6907> of the cup<WH3563> of trembling<WH8653>, and wrung them out<WH4680>.

There is none to guide<WH5095> her among all the sons<WH1121> whom she hath brought forth<WH3205>; neither is there any that taketh<WH2388> her by the hand<WH3027> of all the sons<WH1121> that she hath brought up<WH1431>.

These two<WH8147> things are come<WH7122> unto thee; who shall be sorry<WH5110> for thee? desolation<WH7701>, and destruction<WH7667>, and the famine<WH7458>, and the sword<WH2719>: by whom shall I comfort<WH5162> thee?

Thy sons<WH1121> have fainted<WH5968>, they lie<WH7901> at the head<WH7218> of all the streets<WH2351>, as a wild bull<WH8377> in a net<WH4364>: they are full<WH4392> of the fury<WH2534> of the LORD<WH3068>, the rebuke<WH1606> of thy God<WH430>.
¶ Therefore hear<WH8085> now this, thou afflicted<WH6041>, and drunken<WH7937>, but not with wine<WH3196>:

Thus saith<WH559> thy Lord<WH113> the LORD<WH3068>, and thy God<WH430> that pleadeth<WH7378> the cause of his people<WH5971>, Behold, I have taken out<WH3947> of thine hand<WH3027> the cup<WH3563> of trembling<WH8653>, even the dregs<WH6907> of the cup<WH3563> of my fury<WH2534>; thou shalt no more<WH3254> drink it again<WH8354>:

But I will put<WH7760> it into the hand<WH3027> of them that afflict<WH3013> thee; which have said<WH559> to thy soul<WH5315>, Bow down<WH7812>, that we may go over<WH5674>: and thou hast laid<WH7760> thy body<WH1460> as the ground<WH776>, and as the street<WH2351>, to them that went over<WH5674>.
